intro: Centaurea drabifolia subsp. cappadocica, commonly known as Cappadocian knapweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the sunflower family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Native to Turkey and parts of the Middle East, this subspecies thrives in rocky and arid environments. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in open habitats such as steppes and grasslands. The plant is notable for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions, making it a hardy wildflower in its native range.
